docs.lead_paragraph: Depending on which recent poll you believe, anywhere from 10 to 38 percent of Americans support a ban on horse racing. Debate lingers over how much the emotionally charged aftermath of the death of Eight Belles in the Kentucky Derby swayed public opinion on this matter. But for the sake of argument, let's grant the extremists their wish, in theory. What would happen if thoroughbred racing - as of this instant - suddenly became illegal in the United States?

headline.main: O.K., Ban Racing ... But Then What?

docs.abstract: Be careful what you wish for if you think thoroughbreds would be better off without racing.
docs.snippet: Be careful what you wish for if you think thoroughbreds would be better off without racing.

docs.lead_paragraph: Repeated instances in which popular medicines proved deadly have prompted further monitoring of drugs already on the market.
